title: Diplomatic opening on Iran nuclear issue
summary: Initial talks in Oman between Americans and Iranians, facilitated by their host, have led to a new round of negotiations set for April 19.

title: Israel offers Hamas 45-day ceasefire, demands hostage release
summary: Militants took 251 hostages during the October 7, 2023 attacks that set off the war. Some 58 are still held in Gaza, including 34 the Israeli military says are dead. A Hamas official, on Monday, says it wants a 'permanent' ceasefire, 'a full Israeli withdrawal from the Gaza Strip, and the entry of aid.'

title: US veterans express sorrow and shame over Trump administration
summary: Traditionally aligned with the Republicans, veterans are increasingly angry with the US president, whom they accuse of contempt for the uniform and of betraying the United States' historical allies.

title: Russia claims its deadly attack on Ukraine's Sumy targeted military forces
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has called for a global response to the attack, saying the first strike hit university buildings and the second exploded above street level. 'Only real pressure on Russia can stop this," he said Monday.

title: El Salvador President Bukele says 'of course' he won't be releasing Maryland man back to the US
summary: Trump administration officials emphasized that Abrego Garcia, who was sent to a notorious gang prison in El Salvador, was a citizen of that country and that the US has no say in his future.

title: The challenge of reindustrialization in France: Factories, yes, but 'not in my backyard'
summary: A number of industrial projects are being challenged by groups of local residents and environmental opponents. These tensions raise the question of the social acceptability of factories at a time when France is seeking to reindustrialize.

title: 'From the very beginning, the debt imposed by France on Haiti plunged the country into ruin'
summary: A group of Haitian intellectuals and writers, in a column for Le Monde, says that the obligation imposed on the young Republic of Haiti two centuries ago to 'compensate former colonists' deserves reparations.

title: Meta says to train AI models on public data of European users
summary: People based in the EU who use Meta platforms can opt out of having their data used for training purposes, the social networking giant said, walking back on its claims the chatbot was not trained on data from European users.

title: Macron calls for reform of Palestinian Authority to govern post-war Gaza
summary: France backs a plan to sideline Hamas and empower a reformed Ramallah-based leadership as part of a renewed push for a two-state solution.

title: Hungarian lawmakers back rights restrictions on LGBTQ people, dual nationals
summary: An amendment that legal experts have said could be contrary to human rights conventions was passed in the Hungarian parliament with 140 votes in favor to 21 against.

title: Tensions once again escalate between Paris and Algiers after expulsion of 12 French diplomats
summary: Algeria said it was retaliating following the French police's arrest of a consular official as part of the investigation into the kidnapping of anti-regime influencer Amir Boukhors.

title: War in Ukraine: After deadly bombing in Sumy, peace negotiations take bitter turn
summary: At least 34 people were killed on Sunday in the center of this city located about 30 kilometers from the Russian border. With ceasefire talks stalled, Donald Trump called the attack 'horrible' but stopped short of implicating Russia.

title: Dozens killed in Nigeria attack as President Tinubu vows crackdown
summary: The massacre marks the latest eruption of violence in a region plagued by intercommunal tensions, land disputes, and weak security.

title: French capital of mountaineering bans second home construction: 'We are losing our soul as we lose residents'
summary: Since 1990, Chamonix, in the French Alps, has lost 10% of its population due to the extremely high housing prices. To curb property speculation, the city hall recently banned any new construction of secondary residences.

title: Zuckerberg testifies at Meta trial as US authorities probe Instagram and WhatsApp takeovers
summary: Federal regulators are accusing the tech giant of using its market power to crush emerging rivals instead of competing with them.

title: 5.2-magnitude quake shakes Southern California
summary: The quake struck 8.3 miles (13.4 kilometers) deep near the Elsinore fault zone, one of the busiest seismic areas in California and part of the famous San Andreas fault system that usually sees at least one magnitude 4.0 quake every year, according to a Southern California seismologist.

title: The letter of a Ukrainian father to Trump: 'I am addressing you on behalf of the nine children killed in a Russian strike'
summary: On April 4, nine children were killed in Kryvy Rih. Roman Nikitskyi, a 41-year-old Ukrainian civil servant and whose 15-year-old son died in the attack, wrote a letter to the US prsident, asking him to send Patriot defense systems.

title: French tourists are turning away from the US
summary: Travel agencies are seeing a notable decline in bookings due to prices and the political context. Among those who do choose to go to the US, travel habits are changing.

title: Europe massively affected by effects of climate change in 2024, study finds
summary: The year was the hottest ever recorded on the continent, with record temperatures in Central, Eastern, and Southeastern Europe. Storms were violent and floods widespread, according to the Copernicus report.

title: 'In 'Severance,' I feel like I'm seeing the version of myself I don't want to become': When the series makes its way to university
summary: At the Université Sorbonne-Paris-Nord, a professor has invited students to analyze the hit Apple TV+ series. The show seems to captivate a generation that identifies with this fiction where consciousness is divided to better endure everyday life.

title: For Japanese chef Sugio Yamaguchi, nature is everywhere in Paris
summary: Behind his counter, the cook carefully combines the treasures of the Earth at Wani, his hybrid venue, part coffee shop, part tea salon, just steps away from the Montparnasse Tower.

title: How Israel is seizing large parts of Gaza and reshaping the Palestinian territory
summary: Israel resumed its offensive in the enclave on March 18. While the stated goal was to put pressure on Hamas for a hostage release agreement, the current operations have turned into a redrawing of Gaza, foreshadowing complete control of the Strip.

title: Trump administration freezes $2.2 billion funding for Harvard after university rejects demands
summary: The elite institution vowed to defend its independence, refusing to comply with directives it says overstep legal authority and threaten academic freedom and constitutional rights.

title: Algerian expulsion of French diplomats 'will have consequences,' says French foreign minister
summary: Tensions were mounting between Paris and Algiers after Algeria decided to expel 12 French officials in retaliation for the arrest in France of an Algerian consular official. French Foreign Minister Jean-Nöel Barrot said on Tuesday, 'if Algeria chooses escalation, we will respond with the greatest firmness.'

title: Serbian protests: Students block the public broadcaster
summary: They accuse the national broadcaster of ignoring their movement and their protests. They have pitched tents in front of the RTS and the RTV and have promised to continue their blockade.

title: US Democrats struggle amid the 'chaos' of Trump's trade war
summary: The American opposition is searching for the right response to new tariffs, fearing they might appear to defend financial markets or contradict their own past protectionist policies.

title: EU pledges €1.6 billion for the Palestinian Authority
summary: On Monday, European leaders held their first high-level political talks with the Palestinian government, two months after meeting with Israel. Despite their financial aid, Europe has struggled to influence the political process.

title: Trump's fight against immigration takes priority over the law
summary: By hosting Salvadoran President Nayib Bukele at the White House on Monday and by defending the unjust expulsion of a Salvadoran legally residing in the US, Donald Trump dismissed the rule of law in favor of numerical targets, placing quotas above judicial authority.

title: 'The surge in infant mortality in France is a national disgrace surrounded by a deafening silence'
summary: France is unable to assess the impact of various factors contributing to the resurgence of this scourge, writes Le Monde columnist Philippe Bernard.
